intro: Lesquerella subumbellata, commonly known as the narrow-umbel lesquerella, is a species native to the southwestern United States. It is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by elongated pods containing seeds. Lesquerella subumbellata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its seeds are used in the production of oils and have potential applications in industrial and medicinal fields.
